revised_title: Investigating the Differences in the Magnetic Needle on Board the Investigator
tldr: The author, Matthew Flinders, investigates the differences in the magnetic needle's direction on board the Investigator due to alterations in the ship's heading. He observes that the compass readings vary when the ship's head is in different directions, and suggests methods to correct or allow for these differences in order to improve the accuracy of bearings and charting.
